title.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, national institutions will have the capacity to improve access to, relevance and quality of integrated services for early childhood, especially for children with disabilities., which contributes to Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children will have access to high-quality, relevant, inclusive integrated care services for early childhood and education services.

mailing-address.narrative: Avenida Anacaona No.9 Casa de Naciones Unidas 3er. piso Mirador Sur Santo Domingo

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services
Social and behavioural change communication for ECD

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, national institutions will have the capacity to improve access to, relevance and quality of integrated services for early childhood, especially for children with disabilities.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the strengthening of ECD national policy through integrated programming, by improving the quality of INAIPI's comprehensive early childhood care services with an online monitoring system for home visits to families and training its staff in Communication for Development, implementing an intersectoral initiative to include Care for Child Development for early childhood service providers, with a communication campaign reinforcing fathers´ role in the stimulation and care of their children in their first years of life, and promoting family-friendly policies in the workplace and good business practices to facilitate parents to take care of their children during early childhood. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/02/2020
